com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.recovery

Class DefaultRecoveryPlanManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.recovery.DefaultRecoveryPlanManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PlanManager

    public class DefaultRecoveryPlanManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements PlanManager
    DefaultRecoveryPlanManager enables monitoring and management of recovery plan.

    This is an implementation of PlanManager that performs task recovery using dynamically generated Plan. DefaultRecoveryPlanManager tracks currently failed (permanent) and stopped (transient) tasks, generates a new RecoveryStep for them and adds them to the recovery Plan, if not already added.

      • getCandidates

        public java.util.Collection<? extends Step> getCandidates(java.util.Collection<PodInstanceRequirement> dirtyAssets)
        Description copied from interface: PlanManager
        Determines the next Steps that should be considered for scheduling. Steps that are being selected by other PlanManagers are provided as dirtyAssets as a hint to this PlanManager to assist with scheduling.
        Specified by:
        getCandidates in interface PlanManager
        Parameters:
        dirtyAssets - Other Steps/assets that are already claimed for scheduling elsewhere
        Returns:
        One or more Steps that can be scheduled or an empty Collection when there is no Step to schedule, which may happen if for example all incomplete Steps are already being worked on by other PlanManagers

      • update

        public void update(Protos.TaskStatus status)
        Updates the recovery plan if necessary.

        1. Updates existing steps. 2. If the needs recovery and doesn't yet have a step in the plan, removes any COMPLETED steps for this task (at most one step for a given task can exist) and creates a new PENDING step.

        Specified by:
        update in interface PlanManager
        Parameters:
        status - task status

      • updatePlan

      • getDirtyAssets

        public java.util.Set<PodInstanceRequirement> getDirtyAssets()
        Description copied from interface: PlanManager
        Returns a Set of assets that are dirty, i.e. being worked upon by the Plan that this PlanManager is working on.
        Specified by:
        getDirtyAssets in interface PlanManager
        Returns:
        A Set containing assets that are dirty
